Comments_List: read lots of papers regarding latest biomedical engineering research methods and information about cancer.
The class discussion could be more robust, and I woud appreciate if Prof. Mak provided more insights. That said, the selection of paper is good, and in general student's critics are helfpul.

Totally recommend if you are a BME and wants to engage in more research. This class will build up your paper reading skill and grant/ research proposal writing skills. The workload is very manageable during the semester, but can get quite heavy at the end. The class is at a nice intersection of engineering and biology, and you will learn about how the techniques are invented, and how they are used to further discovery.  

 Prof. Mak is very accessible, smart and logical. His materials are always super organized and facilitate learning well.
